topics.body:
"@Princessâ™ Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a61fb46368721b6b211300#post_54a61fb46368721b6b211300
I guess it was because of how unapologetic and insincere the staff was in regards to that Anderson blunder. Also, you have to admit that the quality of the comics have been deteriorating lately. It's a disturbing trend. I like to believe they may come back good again, but from the looks of things right now, it doesn't give much optimism. But for the show on the other hand, since how well season 4 finale and RR performed, I have much hope (cautiously). I guess people are especially mad at the comic because of the long hiatus, more people pay attention to the comics right now. Once season 5 starts, people might not give the comics this much attention.

Quick question; how is the show doing?  I haven't watched the show since season 3.  Like rate the individual seasons on the scale of 1-10 and rate season 4; also on the scale of 1-10 how are the comics currently?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a624386368724ea5310d00#post_54a624386368724ea5310d00
 I never thought the comics were THAT good from the start personally, more like popcorn comics. Except the Spike Microseries and the Gazebo arc.

I haven't read much past the Nightmarity arc. Just a few friends forevers and they didn't seem that bad. But yeah. I think the comics will bounce back. I;ve seen it before in other comics with lots of writers. Period of shiete, then it gets okay or good for a period, rinse repeat. And occasionally a crown jewel comes out.

i forget what this game is called
but the numbers show how many spaces get filled the row or column
so if it's 0 all the spaces are empty
and if it's 3 and then 4, it means 3 get filled, then there is a gap and then 4
